definitions: having a slight red color or tinge; somewhat red
examples: The sunset cast a reddish glow over the mountains
Her reddish hair gleamed in the sunlight

definitions: capable of being redeemed, saved, or made better through effort
able to be exchanged for money, goods, or services
examples: Despite his flaws, she believed he was redeemable
The character's redeemable qualities emerged later in the story
These coupons are redeemable at participating stores
The bonds are redeemable after five years

definitions: saved from sin, error, or evil through divine grace or effort
recovered through payment or exchange; fulfilled as promised
examples: The redeemed soul found peace at last
He felt redeemed after making amends for his mistakes
The redeemed vouchers were processed immediately
Her redeemed shares increased in value

definitions: serving to compensate for faults or bad aspects; making something acceptable
examples: Her kindness was her one redeeming quality
The film's redeeming feature was its stunning cinematography

definitions: bringing about redemption or salvation; having the quality of redeeming
examples: The story explores redemptive themes of forgiveness
She found redemptive power in helping others

definitions: distributed again or anew, especially in a different way or pattern
examples: The redistributed wealth benefited lower income families
Resources were redistributed according to need

definitions: made smaller in size, amount, degree, or importance than before
brought to a simpler or lower form, state, or condition
examples: The store offered reduced prices during the sale
Her reduced workload allowed more family time
The complex equation was reduced to simpler terms
The sauce was reduced by simmering

definitions: capable of being reduced or made simpler, smaller, or less complex
examples: This complex problem is reducible to basic principles
The fraction is reducible to simpler terms

definitions: analyzing complex phenomena by reducing them to simple or fundamental principles
examples: His reductionist approach ignored important nuances
The reductionist view failed to capture the whole picture

definitions: tending to present complex things in an oversimplified way that distorts them
examples: Her reductive analysis missed crucial details
The reductive argument failed to convince experts

definitions: not needed because something else exists or serves the same purpose
dismissed from employment because no longer needed for the job
examples: The redundant information was removed from the report
Multiple backup systems made failures redundant
Several workers were made redundant during restructuring
She felt redundant after the automation

definitions: having a thin, high-pitched quality like a reed instrument
covered with or containing many reeds; marshy
examples: His reedy voice carried across the room
The clarinet produced a reedy tone
The reedy marshland attracted many waterfowl
They walked through the reedy shoreline

definitions: mentioned as a source of information or cited as evidence
examples: The referenced articles supported her argument
All referenced materials appear in the bibliography

definitions: having or showing education, good taste, and sophistication in manner
made pure by removing unwanted substances; improved through development
examples: Her refined manners impressed the dinner guests
He had refined taste in classical music
The refined sugar dissolved quickly in water
The refined process eliminated all defects

definitions: thrown back by a surface such as mirror or water
characterized by or showing careful thought and consideration
examples: The reflected light dazzled her eyes
His reflected image appeared in the window
Her reflected thoughts appeared in the journal
The decision showed reflected wisdom

definitions: throwing back light, heat, or sound from a surface
examples: The reflecting surface of the lake was mirror-like
Reflecting glass covered the building

definitions: characterized by deep thought or careful consideration of things
capable of reflecting light, images, or sound waves
examples: She was in a reflective mood after the meeting
His reflective nature made him a good counselor
The reflective tape glowed in the headlights
Reflective surfaces help brighten the room

definitions: performed as an automatic and involuntary response to stimulus
examples: The doctor tested her reflex responses
His reflex action saved them from danger

definitions: directed back on itself or on the subject performing the action
denoting a pronoun referring back to the subject of the clause
examples: His reflexive criticism was harsh but honest
The reflexive nature of consciousness fascinated philosophers
The reflexive pronoun 'myself' refers to the speaker
This verb takes a reflexive construction

definitions: intended or serving to reform or improve behavior, especially of young offenders
examples: The reformatory measures helped troubled youth
Reformatory institutions focused on rehabilitation

definitions: changed for the better, especially regarding behavior or beliefs
relating to a reformed branch of Protestant church
examples: The reformed criminal became a youth counselor
His reformed habits improved his health
The Reformed Church held services on Sunday
Reformed theology emphasized divine grace

definitions: supporting or advancing gradual reform rather than revolution or radical change
examples: The reformist politician advocated incremental changes
Her reformist agenda focused on education

definitions: relating to or causing the bending of light or other waves when passing through
examples: The refractive index determines light bending
Refractive errors cause vision problems

definitions: stubborn or difficult to manage; resistant to treatment or cure
able to withstand high temperatures without melting or breaking
examples: The refractory infection resisted all antibiotics
His refractory behavior frustrated teachers
Refractory bricks line the furnace walls
The refractory material withstood extreme heat

definitions: having regained energy or strength; feeling revitalized and alert
examples: She felt refreshed after the short nap
The refreshed team played with new energy

definitions: serving to refresh or revitalize; cool and invigorating
welcome and pleasant because new or different from usual
examples: The refreshing breeze cooled the hot afternoon
A refreshing drink quenched her thirst
His refreshing honesty surprised everyone
The movie offered a refreshing take on the genre

definitions: serving to cool or freeze; used in refrigeration systems
examples: The refrigerant gas circulated through the system
Refrigerant properties determine cooling efficiency

definitions: kept at a cold temperature to preserve freshness or prevent spoilage
examples: The refrigerated truck transported fresh produce
Refrigerated storage extends shelf life

definitions: befitting or resembling a monarch; magnificently royal in appearance or manner
examples: She maintained a regal bearing throughout the ceremony
The regal palace impressed all visitors

definitions: reformed spiritually or morally; given new life or energy
examples: The regenerate soul found peace and purpose
His regenerate spirit inspired others

definitions: regrowing or renewing lost or damaged tissue, parts, or capabilities
examples: The regenerating tissue healed the wound
Regenerating forests covered the burned area

definitions: acting as ruler in place of a monarch who is absent or too young
examples: The regent prince governed during the king's illness
A regent council managed state affairs

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a military regiment or its organization
examples: The regimental colors were displayed proudly
Regimental traditions were strictly observed

definitions: organized according to a strict system or pattern with little freedom
examples: Their regimented lifestyle left no room for spontaneity
The regimented schedule controlled every hour

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a particular region or area
examples: Regional differences affected voting patterns
The regional office handled local concerns

definitions: officially recorded on a list or register; formally enrolled
showing or expressing an emotion or reaction visibly
examples: Only registered voters could participate
The registered trademark protected the brand
Her face registered complete surprise
The thermometer registered ninety degrees

definitions: returning to an earlier or less developed state; becoming worse or declining
examples: The regressive tax policy hurt poor families most
His regressive behavior worried the therapist

definitions: causing or deserving regret; unfortunate and worthy of disappointment
examples: His regrettable decision cost him the promotion
The regrettable incident damaged their friendship

definitions: happening or done at fixed intervals; following a pattern
conforming to accepted standards or established rules
usual, normal, or customary; not special or different
examples: She maintained regular exercise habits
The regular meetings occurred every Monday
The building followed regular geometric patterns
Regular verbs follow standard conjugation rules
He ordered his regular coffee and bagel
She was a regular customer at the shop

definitions: controlled or governed by rules, laws, or principles to ensure proper functioning
examples: The regulated industry followed strict guidelines
Heavily regulated markets protected consumers

definitions: conforming to regulations; of the prescribed or standard type
examples: She wore regulation uniform to the ceremony
The regulation equipment met safety standards

definitions: relating to or responsible for making and enforcing rules and regulations
examples: The regulatory body imposed new standards
Regulatory compliance costs increased annually

definitions: helping to restore someone to health or normal life through training and therapy
examples: The rehabilitative program helped injured workers
Rehabilitative services improved patient outcomes

definitions: currently holding a particular title or position, especially in sports
examples: The reigning champion defended her title successfully
He was the reigning expert in the field

definitions: strengthened or supported with additional material, force, or assistance
examples: The reinforced concrete withstood the earthquake
Reinforced seams prevented the fabric from tearing

definitions: given new energy, strength, or vitality; revitalized and refreshed
examples: The reinvigorated team won three straight games
She felt reinvigorated after the vacation

definitions: dismissed as inadequate, unacceptable, or not chosen; refused
examples: The rejected proposal lacked supporting evidence
He felt rejected after the harsh criticism

definitions: feeling or expressing great joy, delight, or triumph
examples: The rejoicing crowd celebrated the victory
Rejoicing families welcomed soldiers home

definitions: able to be related to or understood because of shared experiences or feelings
examples: Her relatable stories resonated with young audiences
The character's struggles were highly relatable

definitions: connected or associated with something else in some way
belonging to the same family through blood or marriage
examples: These problems are closely related to poverty
The related issues require joint solutions
The two scientists were related through marriage
All related family members attended the reunion
